channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Asymmetric Capital Partners raises $137 million second fund, beating ZIRP-era odds
item.description: Asymmetric has raised its $137 million second fund, passing its original $125 million target, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: From Belém to the world: a financial approach to climate and inclusion
item.description: Now is the time to make bold commitments to protect our planet and care for people.

item.title: Warren Buffett plowed more than $1 billion into three stocks, and it says a lot about where he sees consumers’ priorities right now: Houses, beer, and gas
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway's 2025 investments focus on consumer-driven brands like Lennar, Chevron, and Constellation.

item.title: The secrets and rituals behind the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Europe
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.
